ETYMOLOGY: A syntactic idiom combining the comparative degree 'sooner' with negation 'no' and the conjunction 'than' to express the shortest possible time difference between two events.
SINCE: Appears in English formal syntax constructions dating back to the 16th century.

MEANINGS.PATTERN: [No sooner + auxiliary verb (had/did) + subject + main verb] than [subject + verb]
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A fixed phrase used to connect two clauses, functioning as an adverbial phrase of time.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to show that one event occurs immediately after another, emphasizing the rapidity of the sequence. When beginning a sentence, it requires the subject and auxiliary verb to be inverted.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一...就...; 刚一...就...。用于表示一个事件紧接着另一个事件发生，强调动作发生的即时性。置于句首时需倒装。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: No sooner had the alarm sounded than everyone rushed out of the building.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 警报刚一响起，所有人就冲出了大楼。

REGISTER: Academic, formal writing, or literary narration.
